newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Sappi rises after IBCA reaffirms ratings.
newsitem.headline: Sappi rises after IBCA reaffirms ratings.

text.p: Sappi Ltd shares rose in active trade on Tuesday, boosted by the IBCA rating agency's reaffirmation of the pulp and paper firm's domestic ratings on Monday.
Dealers said there were also perceptions that the paper cycle had turned and pulp and paper prices would start to improve.
"An international rating agency affirmed Sappi's rating and a report by one brokerage said the paper cycle has turned, calling Sappi a medium-term buy," one dealer said.
Sappi shares rose 115 cents to 43.75 rand in brisk turnover worth 7.37 million rand.

IBCA said on Monday it had reaffirmed Sappi's short-term "A1" and long-term "A" domestic ratings, reflecting a low expectation of investment risk and a strong capacity for timely repayment of interest and principal.

It also said the outlook for the group's main product markets appeared more positive than negative, with the rate of recovery expected to be gradual in the near-term before accelerating later in 1998.
